answerText: Antigone[10] Antigone's most notable appearances are in Oedipus at Colonnus and Antigone by this playwright.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Editors 3 | 15 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character is prevented from accessing her father's tomb by Theseus in one play; in another, she has her hair cut and mourning clothes put on by her mother in an attempt to stop a civil war. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this character who fails to prevent combat in The Phoenician Women and argues with a herald in the final scene of Seven Against Thebes
